title: Sri Lanka requests Japan to establish EV battery plant in SL
content: Sri Lanka has made a proposal to Japan on the establishment of a Giga Electric Vehicle (EV) battery factory in the country.The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Japan Sanjiv Gunasekara pointed out the high quality of graphite that is available in Sri Lanka of which 30% is a raw material for EV batteries.He requested Japan to consider a Giga EV battery factory in Sri Lanka where the products can be exported to India and Pakistan.Ambassador Gunasekara also revealed that Sri Lanka is the only country that has Free Trade Agreements with India and Pakistan with access to over 1.6 billion people.He made the observation during an online webinar that was organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Japan, with the participation of over 80 prospective Japanese companies.During the webinar, the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Japan also highlighted the investment synergies between Japan and Sri Lanka, emphasizing investment opportunities in the IT sector, renewable energy, and agricultural technology.
